protocol.title: Protocol for Subculture of Differentiated Blood-Brain Barrier Endothelial Cells onto Plates and Filters
protocol.title_html: Protocol for Subculture of Differentiated Blood-Brain Barrier Endothelial Cells onto Plates and Filters

source.description: Please select between subculturing onto plates or filters.

Coat plates with ECM plate solution for at least
at
. Volume depends on plate type (see Table):
ABC
1Plate type for subculture phaseVolume of ECM solution for coatingWorking volume of EC media for cell culture
26-well800 μl2 ml
312-well250 μl1 ml
424-well200 μl500 μl
548-well100 μl400 μl
696-well50 μl200 μl

ABC
1Plate type for subculture phaseVolume of ECM solution for coatingWorking volume of EC media for cell culture
26-well800 μl2 ml
312-well250 μl1 ml
424-well200 μl500 μl
548-well100 μl400 μl
696-well50 μl200 μl

source.body: If desired, plates may be coated . If coating overnight, add necessary volume of ECM and an equal volume of ddH2O to each well to prevent excessive evaporation. If using glass plates, overnight incubation is needed to achieve adequate protein adsorption.

source.description: Aspirate plates and allow to dry in sterile hood (place the plate in the back of the hood and leave the lid slightly ajar).

source.body: Plates only need to dry for (can be aspirated during accutase incubation). Do not over dry!

source.description: Retrieve cells from incubator and transfer equal volume of spent media to 15 ml conical corresponding to the number of wells being accutased.

source.body: For example, if accutasing 4 wells, save 4 ml of spent media and discard the rest.

source.description:
Wash each well once with
PBS.

Add
accutase (warmed to
) to each well.

Incubate at
, length of time depends on cell treatment:

cases.title: If cells have not been treated with RA
If cells have been treated with RA

source.description: Using p1000, collect cells, and spray gently over surface 2–3x to dislodge any remaining cells. Triturate briefly to break up cell clumps.
Add cells to 15 ml conical containing spent media.

Spin down cells at
.

Aspirate media, and resuspend cells in appropriate volume of EC media (with or without
RA). For 6- and 12-wells, cells are seeded based on a split ratio:
  • 1 well of a 6-well plate is split to 1 well of a 6-well plate [1:1]
  • 1 well of a 6-well plate is split to 3 wells of a 12-well plate [1:3]
  • For smaller plates (24-, 48-, or 96-wells), seed 1 million cells/cm2.
Multiply split ratio by the working volume found in the table to arrive at total volume of EC media (with or without
RA) in which to resuspend cells.
Thoroughly triturate 3 – 4 times to yield single cell suspension.
Add appropriate volume of cells to each well.
Place plate in incubator, shaking plate back and forth to distribute cells evenly (do not swirl).
24 hours later (i.e., day 7), aspirate spent media and add appropriate volume of EC medium (without bFGF and RA).

Coat Transwell filters with
of ECM filter solution.

source.body: Note: owing to the complexity of filter washing and separate addition of media to the top and bottom chambers of filters, make sure you calculate the necessary volumes of EC media before starting the passaging step.

source.description:
Aspirate filters and allow to dry in sterile hood, similar to the description for plates. Filters should dry for at least
but no longer than
. If cells are still dissociating after
, move to step 10.1 before performing steps 5 – 9.
Retrieve cells from incubator and transfer equal volume of spent media to 15 ml conical corresponding to the number of wells being accutased.

source.body: For example, if accutasing 4 wells, save of spent media and discard the rest.

Following accutase incubation, use p1000 to collect cells and spray gently over surface 2–3x to dislodge any remaining cells. Triturate briefly to break up cell clumps.
Add accutased cells to the conical containing spent medium.

Aspirate media, resuspend cells in appropriate volume of EC media (with or without
RA). Cells are seeded based on a 1:3 ratio (i.e. 1 well of a six well plate seeds three Transwell filters).

Place plate in incubator, shaking plate back and forth to distribute cells evenly (do not swirl).

24 hours later (i.e., day 7), aspirate and change to EC medium lacking bFGF or RA.
    Gently add EC medium lacking bFGF or RA,
    in top chamber and
    in bottom chamber. DO NOT include bFGF or RA in the medium – these factors prevent the monolayer from tightening.
